By James Bithell

York's men's darts team have won the 2014 North East University Darts League after beating Sheffield 6-5 in a close-run final in James College

College Cup finals day in pictures

With the College Cup over for another year, we take a visual look back upon this year's competition, which saw Halifax firsts and seconds take the top two titles and James thirds clinch the Vase

James thirds lift the Vase after close encounter with Goodricke

James Thirds won a tense College Vase final 5-4 on penalties, after the match finished 1-1 in normal time

Heath the hero as Halifax lift Cup again

Halifax firsts beat Derwent firsts 1-0 in the final to claim their third College Cup victory in four years, in a match marred by an injury to Fax's Dan Jones

College Cup Final 2014: As it happened

Live coverage of the final round of fixtures from this year's College Cup, as Halifax firsts win the competition for the third time in four years

James cruise past Goodricke to clinch third

James firsts put the disappointment of their semi-final defeat behind them, thrashing Goodricke firsts 4-0 to finish third in the tournament

Slick Fax reach College Cup final

Connor McCoy's Halifax firsts made it to their fourth successive College Cup final, after seeing off pre-tournament favourites James firsts

A sensational summer of sport

As the Summer Term draws to a close, Beth Jakubowski looks forward to the sporting action ahead in the coming months from the Tour de France to England Test matches

Halifax face James in crunch match

Halifax firsts take on James firsts in the College Cup semi final on Tuesday, with both sides fighting it out for a place in Friday's final against Derwent firsts

Fax cruise through to Plate final

Halifax thirds made it through to the Plate final on Monday, after an efficient performance saw them run out as 2-0 winners over Alcuin seconds on the JLD

By James Bithell

James thirds put in a solid performance on the new JLD to hold out for a 1-0 won over Langwith seconds in the Vase semi final

A brace from Josh Bew sent Derwent into a second consecutive College Cup final, as they prevailed 2-0 in a cagey and ill-tempered semi final with Goodricke yesterday
